page.title: 17Changing Times - 1945
page.content: Fochriw was smaller than it is today even with the Royal Engineers' Camp.Soldiers trained to build bridges over water.The council houses had hot and cold water,coal fires ,an upstairs bath,a lavatory with an out side door and electric light.There was no gas or central heating.The terraced houses had cold water,coal fires and some had paraffin lights.There was a good railway system.The doctor and undertaker had cars with a petrol ration.They were essential war services.Everybody worked.Men worked in the mines and women in the Glascoed Munition Factory.There were six telephones in Fochriw.Most people had a radio.The Victory in Europe was celebrated with dances,street parties, bonfires and sports.
